name: Macca
description: Mecca, in a desert valley in western Saudi Arabia, is Islam’s holiest city, as it’s the birthplace of the Prophet Muhammad and the faith itself.

name: Bali
description: You’ll find beaches, volcanoes, Komodo dragons and jungles sheltering elephants, orangutans and tigers. Basically, it’s paradise.

name: Niagara Falls
description: Walk up to the edge of the falls, or take a boat tour for a close-up look at the water pouring over the lip of the gorge above you.

name: Mount Kilimanjaro
description: The highest peak in all of Africa, this majestic mountain - a dormant volcano - is one of the most recognizable symbols of the continent.

name: Forbidden City
description: Like the Great Wall, the Forbidden City in Beijing is one of the top places to visit in China.

name: Stonehenge
description: EngStonehenge is one of those places that makes you ponder what went on here over 4,500 years ago.

name: Banff National Park
description: The glacial lakes in Canada's first national park have some of the bluest water you've ever seen.

name: Pamukkale
description: Put every infinity pool you’ve ever seen to shame with these natural, snow-white hot springs overlooking the nearby city of Denizli.

name: Mù Cang Chải
description: Get off the beaten path in this rural district where the rice paddy-terraced mountains and twisting streams will make you feel like you’re living in a fairy tale.

name: Borobudur
description: Borobudur dates from the 9th century and is one of the largest Buddhist temples in the world.

name: Hamnøy
description: Hamnøy in Lofoten has become known, the world over, for its impressive landscape and unspoilt charm… and it’s easy to see why.

name: The Matterhorn
description: The Matterhorn, Switzerland's iconic pointed peak is one of the highest mountains in the Alps.

name: Maroon Bells
description: The Maroon Bells are two 14,000-foot peaks in the Elk Mountains that are reflected in crystal-clear Maroon Lake, snuggled in a glacial valley.

name: Grand Canyon
description: The Grand Canyon is a steep, 1-mile-deep, and up to 18-mile-wide gash in the fabric of the world, an immense gorge carved by the Colorado River over the last 5,000 years.

name: Blue Ridge Mountains
description: The Blue Ridge Mountains stretch from their southernmost end in Georgia all the way northward to Pennsylvania.
